snippet: Senator Rand Paul, in a speech at Berkeley, injected the issue of race into the debate over domestic surveillance by saying President Obama should be wary given the government’s history of eavesdropping on civil rights leaders.
abstract: Sen Rand Paul injects race into debate over domestic spying, suggesting that Pres Obama should be particularly wary given the government's history of eavesdropping on civil rights leaders; speech, at the University of California, Berkeley, is part of Paul's effort to bring his brand of libertarian conservatism to audiences in less friendly territory ahead of 2016 presidential election.
lead_paragraph: Senator Rand Paul, in a speech at Berkeley, injected the issue of race into the debate over domestic surveillance by saying President Obama should be wary given the government’s history of eavesdropping on civil rights leaders.

headline.main: Rand Paul, Warning About Spying, Faults Obama
headline.print_headline: Paul, Warning About Spying, Faults Obama
